conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. Given School_E’s repeated rejections due to holding the seat for higher-priority students, the best strategy is to continue applying with a clear, immediate-commitment signal and a concise check on whether the higher-priority candidates have now matched elsewhere, so School_E can release the seat if available.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in School_E and for reaffirming that we are your first choice. Given the current state of the process and our available seat, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_E.

If you still intend to enroll immediately, please confirm your acceptance and be ready to complete the enrollment steps as instructed.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_E applied this round. Our true priority list ranks Student_E last, but still acceptable. However, higher-priority students (A-D) all rank School_E last in their preferences, so they are unlikely to ever apply unless all other options fail. Holding the seat longer risks ending unmatched by round 30, while accepting Student_E now guarantees filling the seat with an acceptable student. Given repeated commitment from Student_E and no competing applicants, accept.
